title: Start Pregnancy Safely
tip: Make sure you get enough rest and eat well for your health and the baby's.
who_tips: Eat nutritious foods like fruits and vegetables.
Avoid smoking and drinking alcohol.

title: Continue Monitoring Your Health
tip: Stay hydrated and avoid stress.
who_tips: Drink at least 8 cups of water daily.
Engage in light physical activity like walking.

title: Confirm Pregnancy
tip: Visit a doctor to confirm your pregnancy and get early advice.
who_tips: Take a pregnancy test for confirmation.
Start taking folic acid to support baby development.

title: Take Care of Uterine Health
tip: Avoid anything that might harm the baby like taking unapproved medication.
who_tips: Avoid taking medicines without doctor approval.
See a doctor if you experience pain or anything unusual.

title: Start Light Exercise
tip: Do gentle exercises like calm walking to improve health.
who_tips: Avoid intense or heavy workouts.
Ensure you drink plenty of water.

title: Support Heart and Blood Health
tip: Eat iron-rich foods to prevent anemia.
who_tips: Eat iron-rich foods like chicken, beans, and leafy greens.
Do a blood test to check iron levels.

title: Avoid Stress
tip: Avoid stressful situations to protect your baby’s health.
who_tips: Practice relaxation like prayer or listening to music.
Sleep early to get enough rest.

title: Take Care of Nose and Oral Health
tip: Maintain hygiene and oral care to avoid infections.
who_tips: Brush teeth twice a day.
Avoid substances that harm oral health.

title: Increase Nutritious Food Intake
tip: Eat foods rich in vitamins and minerals.
who_tips: Consume Vitamin C sources like oranges and bananas.
Drink enough water daily.

title: Monitor Body Weight
tip: Maintain healthy weight to avoid complications.
who_tips: Control weight gradually.
Engage in light physical activity like walking.

title: Maintain Body Hygiene
tip: Keep your body clean to reduce the risk of infections.
who_tips: Wash hands before eating.
Bathe regularly.

title: Regulate Body Temperature
tip: Avoid extreme heat or cold environments.
who_tips: Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.
Avoid going out in strong sunlight.

title: Continue Folic Acid Intake
tip: Folic acid helps reduce the risk of birth defects.
who_tips: Eat folate-rich foods like cabbage and beans.
Continue folic acid supplements through week 12.

title: Overall Body Care
tip: Ensure enough sleep and rest for general wellbeing.
who_tips: Sleep at least 7–8 hours per night.
Avoid excessive stress and fatigue.

title: Monitor Blood Pressure
tip: Check blood pressure regularly to prevent issues.
who_tips: Avoid salty foods.
Engage in gentle exercise.

title: Care for Mental Well-being
tip: Do things that help you feel calm and happy.
who_tips: Relax with books or movies you enjoy.
Avoid stress triggers.

title: Monitor Baby’s Development
tip: Visit the doctor to check on baby’s progress.
who_tips: Use ultrasound if recommended.
Ask your doctor any concerns you have.

title: Eat Quality Food
tip: Eat foods rich in essential nutrients.
who_tips: Eat colorful vegetables like green and red ones.
Drink milk or plant-based alternatives.

title: Avoid Smoking
tip: Smoking can cause serious problems for the baby.
who_tips: Don’t smoke, even indoors.
Seek help to quit if needed.

title: Take Care of Your Skin
tip: Moisturize to prevent dryness and swelling.
who_tips: Use gentle moisturizing creams.
Avoid very hot baths.

title: Care for Heart Health
tip: Reduce stress for better heart and blood pressure.
who_tips: Think positively and pray.
Avoid things that stress you out.

title: Continue Physical Activity
tip: Exercise helps your body and baby’s health.
who_tips: Walk calmly for at least 30 minutes daily.
Avoid intense workouts.

title: Watch Your Weight
tip: Keep weight balanced to prevent excessive gain.
who_tips: Eat healthy food without overeating.
Exercise regularly.

title: Take Care of Dental Health
tip: Brush properly to prevent oral issues.
who_tips: Brush twice daily.
Visit the dentist periodically.

title: Avoid Unauthorized Medication
tip: Do not take any drugs without medical advice.
who_tips: Consult a doctor before taking medicine.
Avoid uncertified herbal remedies.

title: Take Care of Breathing
tip: Avoid polluted or smoky environments.
who_tips: Avoid inhaling too much smoke or dust.
Ensure fresh air circulation in the house.

title: Drink Clean Water
tip: Drink clean water regularly for your health and baby’s.
who_tips: Drink purified or filtered water.
Avoid unknown water sources.

title: Continue Folic Acid
tip: Folic acid helps protect against birth issues.
who_tips: Keep taking folic acid till the end.
Eat folate-rich foods.

title: Support Digestion
tip: Avoid foods that cause bloating or nausea.
who_tips: Eat slowly and in small portions.
Avoid spicy foods.

title: Do Medical Checkups
tip: Go for scheduled tests to monitor you and the baby’s health.
who_tips: Follow the doctor’s test schedule.
Ask questions if you have concerns.

title: Support Immune System
tip: Eat immune-boosting foods like citrus fruits.
who_tips: Eat Vitamin C-rich fruits.
Rest well to strengthen immunity.

title: Watch for Warning Signs
tip: Be alert to symptoms like bleeding or pain and seek help.
who_tips: Go to the hospital if there’s bleeding or severe pain.
Inform your doctor of any unusual signs.

title: Care for Vein Health
tip: Take breaks to reduce leg swelling.
who_tips: Raise your legs from time to time.
Avoid sitting or standing in one spot too long.

title: Limit Caffeine
tip: Reduce intake of caffeine like strong tea or coffee.
who_tips: Limit caffeine to 1–2 cups per day.
Avoid caffeine before bedtime.

title: Boost Immune Strength
tip: Eat antioxidant-rich foods like berries.
who_tips: Eat colorful vegetables.
Drink plenty of water.

title: Prepare for Delivery
tip: Start organizing your delivery items and mentally prepare.
who_tips: Get baby items and delivery space ready.
Mentally prepare to reduce labor stress.

title: Track Baby Movements
tip: Monitor baby’s movement to ensure health.
who_tips: Track movements regularly.
Visit the doctor if movements slow down.

title: Maintain Health Before Delivery
tip: Eat well, rest well, and avoid heavy tasks.
who_tips: Avoid heavy work.
Stay hydrated.

title: Prepare for a Smooth Delivery
tip: Get ready physically and spiritually for childbirth.
who_tips: Pray and stay positive.
Consult your doctor or midwife for advice.

title: Complete Birth Preparation
tip: Ensure everything is ready for delivery day.
who_tips: Make sure baby items are packed.
Call your doctor if you notice any changes.
